meanings.definition: A person who presents a request or plea to a higher authority.
meanings.sent1: The postulator submitted the appeal to the court.
meanings.sent2: The postulator asked the judge for help.
meanings.sent3: The postulator joked that he was the 'official beggar' of the group.
meanings.sent4: She was the postulator of good causes, always seeking justice.
meanings.sent5: The postulator's role was to advocate for those in need.

meanings.definition: To present a formal request or petition.
meanings.sent1: He will postulate his case to the council tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She postulated her idea to the committee for consideration.
meanings.sent3: The students postulated for an extra recess period.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer postulated for a fair trial for her client.
meanings.sent5: They postulated their demand for better working conditions.
